com.azure.data.appconfiguration.credentials

Class ConfigurationClientCredentials

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.data.appconfiguration.credentials.ConfigurationClientCredentials

  • public class ConfigurationClientCredentials
extends java.lang.Object
    Credentials that authorizes requests to Azure App Configuration. It uses content within the HTTP request to generate the correct "Authorization" header value. ConfigurationCredentialsPolicy ensures that the content exists in the HTTP request so that a valid authorization value is generated.
    See Also:
    ConfigurationCredentialsPolicy, ConfigurationClientBuilder

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConfigurationClientCredentials(java.lang.String connectionString)
      Creates an instance that is able to authorize requests to Azure App Configuration service.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigurationClientCredentials

        public ConfigurationClientCredentials(java.lang.String connectionString)
                               throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Creates an instance that is able to authorize requests to Azure App Configuration service.
        Parameters:
        connectionString - Connection string in the format "endpoint={endpoint_value};id={id_value};secret={secret_value}"
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When the HMAC-SHA256 MAC algorithm cannot be instantiated.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - When the connectionString secret is invalid and cannot instantiate the HMAC-SHA256 algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • baseUri

        public java.net.URL baseUri()
        Gets the base URI of the Azure App Configuration instance based on the provided connection string.
        Returns:
        The base URI of the configuration service extracted from connection string provided.

      • getAuthorizationHeadersAsync

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getAuthorizationHeadersAsync(java.net.URL url,
                                                                                                                  java.lang.String httpMethod,
                                                                                                                  reactor.core.publisher.Flux<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> contents)
        Gets a list of headers to add to a request to authenticate it to the Azure APp Configuration service.
        Parameters:
        url - the request url
        httpMethod - the request HTTP method
        contents - the body content of the request
        Returns:
        a flux of headers to add for authorization
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the SHA-256 algorithm doesn't exist.
